title: Dual-Language Switching and Inhibitory Control Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental English proficiency and bilingual communication experience
context.additional_context: A process that enhances bilingual switching skills through experiment-based activities in a smartphone-based microlearning environment. Learners develop adaptability to multilingual environments required in daily life or work contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can reduce reaction times by 20% in multilingual switching scenarios
Learners can diagnose their cognitive control levels through inhibitory control ability assessments
Learners can explain changes in brainwave patterns during language switching

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
